Dialogue.NPCText:
You find a woman hunched at a sand-worn workbench, her arms and neck a map of shimmering runes and scars. Her eyes are sharp, wary, but when she speaks, her voice is a whisper of sand and ink.

"You're not the first to seek power, protection, or purpose in my marks. I'm Layla, once a slave of the arena—now Qasaria's only true ward-scribe. My sigils kept me alive when blades failed. If you wish to wear magic on your flesh, you must pay in coin, pain... and something rarer still."

She gestures at her battered satchel and the odd, green-tinged inkwell.
"What do you seek, traveler?"

Option.text: Tell me about yourself.
I want your wards against Minax.
What does your ink do?
Who else comes here?
Your scars… tell me who you really are.
I'm just browsing the bazaar.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Layla lets out a dry laugh.

"Qasaria sees many survivors, but few bear their battles on their skin. I fought in the Sands of Blood arena for Omar al-Onyx—won and lost, scar by scar. The others broke. I drew sigils in stolen soot and scorpion ink—magic to mend wounds, to dull pain, to turn Minax's whispers aside.

When I escaped, Yasmin al-Topaz hid me. In return, I inscribe her scholars, though I trust few in the Council. Zahid of the Undermarket keeps offering to buy my secrets. But I’d rather die with inked dignity than sell my soul. Now, I trade my pain for your protection, if you’re brave enough."
She flexes a hand—sigils shimmer faintly.

Option.text: Do you still fear Omar al-Onyx?
You mention Yasmin al-Topaz. Are you friends?
Who is Zahid of the Undermarket?
Can your sigils really resist Minax?
I need a ward inscribed.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her lips curl into a thin smile.

"Omar thrives on fear. He thinks himself a king, but his crown is blood and sand. I no longer bow to him—or any man. He may rule the arena, but not the streets, not my scars. Should his thugs come for me, let them taste the bite of my ink. If you find yourself in his arena, don’t trust anyone with clean skin."

Option.text: Thank you for the warning. Tell me of your wards.
What of Yasmin al-Topaz?
I want a ward.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Layla’s gaze softens slightly.

"Yasmin saved my life, but she always asks a price. Her magic is older than the city—some say older than death. She studies the Ancients, chases relics, and trusts too few. I’m grateful, but I keep my own secrets. My sigils are my own invention—not even Yasmin knows them all."

Option.text: What of Zahid and the Undermarket?
I want a protective ward.
Can your sigils resist Minax?

Dialogue.NPCText:
She spits in the sand.

"Zahid is a shadow with too many eyes. He deals in secrets, relics, and lives. He wants my formulas for ink, but he’ll never get them. If you go below the Bazaar, watch your purse—and your back. Karim al-Emerald sends his spies to Zahid often. No friend to the weak, that one."

Option.text: I want a ward to protect me.
I’m done with questions.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"My ink is made from scorpion venom and nightbloom petals—ground with silver dust and tears. Each mark is pain, but also power. Wards against madness, poisons, or Minax's corrupting whispers. But the rarest ink—the one you need—must come from a venomous tomb-scourge scorpion. I am out."
She leans forward, hopeful.
"If you fetch it, I’ll inscribe a ward strong enough to turn back Minax’s influence. It will hurt. But you will stand tall when others fall."

Option.text: Where do I find this scorpion ink?
Will your ward truly shield me from Minax?
I want to know more about you.
Let me think.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"You see all sorts in Qasaria. Council merchants in gilded cloaks. Arena warriors hungry for protection or revenge. Even Shadowmaster Zahid's assassins come for tattoos—though I never turn my back on them. I trust only Leila the Sand Dancer; her family brought me food when I had none. If you meet her, tell her Layla remembers."
She pauses.
"Now—what do you seek?"

Option.text: A ward against Minax.
Where can I find scorpion ink?
I’m just looking.

Dialogue.NPCText: Layla nods. "Not everyone has the heart for scars. When you change your mind, my ink is ready." She returns to sharpening a bone needle, eyes never leaving you.

Option.text: On second thought, I want a ward.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Layla inspects your arms, as if imagining patterns already forming there.

"If Minax's shadow worries you, my sigils can buy you time—sometimes, even hope. But I need true scorpion venom ink. Deep in the Tomb of Forgotten Kings, below Qasaria, roam tomb-scourge scorpions. Their glands yield the purest ink for resisting corruption. Bring me three fresh venom glands, and I will mark you with a ward against Minax’s touch. Your soul will ache, but your mind will remain your own."

Option.text: How do I reach the Tomb of Forgotten Kings?
Why does it hurt?
I’ll return with the glands.
This sounds dangerous. I need time.

Dialogue.NPCText: "The Tomb lies beyond the merchant quarter, hidden beneath the sands near the ruined Obelisk of Eternity. Many do not return—the scorpions are drawn to those touched by Minax, and the dead are restless. Seek out their queen, the Grand Matron—her venom is the purest. Bring me three venom glands. When you return, I will give you a ward fit for any true survivor."

Option.text: I will find the glands and return.
Why do your wards hurt so much?
Perhaps another time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Layla traces a scar running down her forearm.

"Magic has a price. The venom burns out what is weak in you—fear, doubt, the subtle taint of Minax. The sigils go deeper than skin. They cut into the soul, sealing cracks where shadows creep. Most flinch, but those who endure walk away changed. When you’re ready, and when you have the venom, come back to me. I’ll inscribe a ward none in Qasaria can match."

Option.text: I will seek the scorpion glands.
I’m not ready.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Layla hands you a worn parchment scroll, inked with a jagged map and strange sigils.

"Take this. When you return with the glands, my ink and needle will be ready. If you survive the Tomb, you’ll have more than a story—you’ll have protection from the darkness rising in every shadow."

"Survive, and you’ll wear your scars with pride."

Option.text: I will return with the venom glands.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Layla’s expression shifts. Her fingers trace a sigil along her collarbone—one that glows faintly in response.

"Few ask that. Fewer want the truth. But... you remind me of someone who once did."

She sets down her stylus. “Ask, then. But know—my past was carved with fire, blood... and choices no child should make.”

Option.text: How did you become a ward-scribe?
What happened in the arena?
You weren’t born here, were you?
What do your tattoos *mean*?
On second thought... too personal.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"There was no mentor. No scroll. Just pain... and need."

"They threw us into cages before the arena—barely fed. I found scraps of soot, scraps of bone... mixed with venom from the rats and scorpions under the pits. Drew on myself—runes I barely understood. But they worked. When others screamed from fear or flame, I stood."

She raises her hand, revealing a faded rune along her palm. "This one silences fear. The first thing I ever made... and the one I still use the most."

Option.text: That’s powerful. Can you teach me that?
That’s powerful. Can you teach me that?
Option.action: SendMessage:Your hands are not ready to hold this wisdom.

Option.text: That explains your strength. What happened in the arena?
Why not flee instead of fight?

Dialogue.NPCText:
She nods once and gestures for your arm.

"You already understand part of the glyph’s shape. Let me show you the rest..."
Her stylus dances over your skin, glowing softly as it writes nothing—yet everything.

Option.text: I’ll remember this. Thank you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Layla shakes her head.

"The ink would burn you. Come back when your hand no longer trembles and your heart understands glyphs beyond beauty."

Option.text: I’ll study until I’m ready.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Pain teaches fast. Death, faster."

"In the arena, you learn the weight of a second. The sound of breath before betrayal. I etched wards to slow my bleeding... to blind enemies... even to make them hallucinate flames. Some called me witch. I called it survival."

Her gaze lingers on your weapon. "I can still hear the crowd. But now I inscribe others, so *they* don’t die in silence."

Option.text: You ever miss it? The fight?
What was your worst match?
Let’s change the subject...

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Sometimes."

"Not the blood, but the clarity. In the pit, everything made sense. Win. Or vanish."

She exhales slowly. "Here in Qasaria... everyone wears masks."

Option.text: You’ve earned your peace.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Layla closes her eyes.

"A beast from Moonglow—twice my size. No name. Just chains. The crowd threw in *fire beetles* for ‘fun.’ I couldn’t run. Couldn’t scream."

"So I inked myself with a death ward. It worked. Barely. When it ended, I wasn’t the same. But I was... still breathing."

Option.text: And now you share that strength with others.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"No. I was born in a caravan crossing the Mirror Wastes, east of Nujel’m. My mother was a silk weaver. My father, a ghost. Never met him."

"Bandits raided us near the Singing Dunes. Sold the survivors to Qasaria’s arenas. I was... nine."

She laughs darkly. "The desert took everything but my will."

Option.text: I’m sorry. That’s a heavy burden.
Option.action: SendMessage:Layla offers you a quiet nod of respect.

Option.text: That must have been hard.
Option.action: SendMessage:She studies your face, unsure if pity or judgment hides there.

Option.text: That explains your resilience.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Layla lifts her arm, running a finger along a fresh sigil.

"Each line is a memory. Each rune, a choice. I don’t just tattoo spells—I *bind moments*. Pain, loss, victory… woven into ink."

"You want a ward? Then understand—it’s not just magic. It’s *your story*, etched in blood and venom."

Option.text: Then make me a sigil of hope.
Give me one of vengeance.
Do you have one for clarity?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Hope is sharpest when carved from despair."
She inscribes a gentle loop over your wrist. Warmth radiates through your veins.
"Remember: even the deepest scar means you survived."

Option.text: Thank you, Layla.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Her voice hardens.
"You’ll burn brighter. But flames consume."
The sigil stings as it sears into your skin—anger focused, cold and perfect.

Option.text: Let them fear me now.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Clarity comes at a cost."
She traces a mirrored glyph behind your ear. Sound fades for a moment, replaced by focused silence.
"Use it when choices cloud. Not all noise is truth."

Option.text: I feel... still.
Option.action: SendMessage:Your mind feels sharper for a moment.
